channel.title: Project Hyperion [PH] - [Killing PI]
channel.description:
[CENTER] [B]Hello, some of you may know my last project as Project iQuality, which I had to quit because I just became so unmotivated because PI has no advantages for me now, documentation sucks, naming is horrible, I could go on, but this isn't a thread to start flame on PI.[/B]
[I][B]This project is going to try and get the hype on hyperion, my goal/aim is to make a hyperion server have as much as PI (content-wise), be basically host-ready and be as simple as PI[/B][/I].
[B]Credits:[/B] Graham - Server Temperance & iHerp - Client
People who have helped me: Harlan - Sprite unpacking issue
[/CENTER] [CENTER][B]Goals[/B]
[b]Server[/b] [IMG]http://images.wikia.com/runescape/images/0/00/Attack.png[/img] [i]Combat[/i] - Player vs NPC - New combat icons - Correct hit timers - 100% range & mage projectiles - Absorption, criticals, deflection - Combat prayers and curses - Correct (or close) hit formulas - Every spellbook spell working - Most (100%) specials
[IMG]http://images.wikia.com/runescape/images/a/a7/Manual_Activites.png[/img] [b]Minigames[/b] [IMG]http://images1.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20100523133651/runescape/images/0/0f/Sacred_clay_%28class_4%29.png[/img] [i]Stealing creations[/i] - Maps (wilderness and in-game) - Gathering clays, from resources, pickpocketing players, getting from base, etc - Creation kiln (for creating tools with gathered clay) - SC Points reward shop
[IMG]http://images.wikia.com/runescape/images/8/87/Bh_icon.png[/img] [i]Bounty Hunter[/i] - Skull color depends on items and equipment value (need to fix item values) - 3 craters with correct level requirements - Getting random target - Correct pickup penalties and target penalties
[IMG]http://images.wikia.com/runescape/images/b/bb/Fist_of_Guthix_icon_highscores.png[/img] [i]Fist of Guthix[/i] - Correct start up items - Getting random target - Stone charging - Ranking - Shop like RS
[IMG]http://images.wikia.com/runescape/images/9/9e/Dharok%27s_helmet.png[/img] [i]Barrows[/i] - Correct barrow brother in tombs - Correct barrow brother effects - Rewards for completing minigame - Earthquake on opening chest - Doors with puzzles - Random prayer drain, while in a brother's tomb or in last cave
[IMG]http://images.wikia.com/runescape/images/7/70/Scanclue.png[/img] [i]Treasure trails[/i] - NPCs drop their correct level'd clue scroll - Coordinate, puzzles, anagram, and talk to clue scrolls - Almost every reward available on RS
[IMG]http://images.wikia.com/runescape/images/d/d0/Statistics.png[/img] [b]Skills[/b] [IMG]http://images1.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20120301175043/runescape/images/c/c8/Ranged.png[/img][i]Ranged[/i] - Red and grey chinchompas - Dwarf multi cannon - Will add more...
[IMG]http://images4.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20120224162843/runescape/images/f/f7/Magic.png[/img][i]Magic[/i] - Staff of armadyl with correct animations and GFXs - Miasmic spells on ancient spellbook - [COLOR="Orange"]Every modern, ancient and lunar spell functional - Balanced hit formula - Correct farcasting, effects, etc
[IMG]http://images3.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20120224163119/runescape/images/3/32/Prayer.png[/img][i]Prayer[/i] - All bones buryable and (All) Bones on altar - ALL prayer/curse effects - Ancient curses. - Correct prayer overlays (i.e no piety and burst of strength) - Prayer head icons - Quick prayers - Quick curses - New prayers (Augury, Rigour, Rapid Renewal)
[IMG]http://images2.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20120118045139/runescape/images/f/f4/Cooking.png[/img][i]Cooking[/i] - Every cookable food is you know...cookable? - Pretty accurate burning formula - Support for multiple fire cooking, i.e cooking in firing ranges, fires, etc.
[IMG]http://images.wikia.com/runescape/images/d/df/Woodcutting.png[/img][i]Woodcutting[/i] - All trees supported (508 objects) - Trees disappearing and spawning back - Accurate tree cutting formula, depending on axe, woodcutting level and tree - Misc items like lumberjack clothes, inferno adze, stealing creation hatchet
[IMG]http://images1.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20120119045123/runescape/images/0/0c/Fletching.png[/img][i]Fletching[/i] - Flax picking and bow stringing - Fletching arrows - Fletching bows - Every log fletchable
[IMG]http://images1.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20120116165214/runescape/images/1/19/Fishing.png[/img][i]Fishing[/i] - All types of fishing support (fly fishing, rod fishing, bare-hand, bait-fishing, etc) - Accurate formula for catching rate - Fishing spots disappearing then respawning in different location - Good timer for fishing spot respawn time.
[b]Client[b] - Will update. [/CENTER]
fml, did ctrl+c instead of v and didn't backup media, ftw. Will have more media back up by tomorrow or wednesday.
[b]Media[/b][CENTER][IMG]http://screensnapr.com/e/0TVslf.png[/img] [IMG]http://screensnapr.com/e/3yZuiL.png[/img] [IMG]http://screensnapr.com/e/SYfUwx.png[/img] [IMG]http://screensnapr.com/e/Qa21z5.png[/img] [IMG]http://screensnapr.com/e/2j7NtB.png[/img] [IMG]http://screensnapr.com/e/wiwbXh.png[/img] [IMG]http://screensnapr.com/e/gaXFCd.png[/img] [IMG]http://screensnapr.com/e/dI25uw.png[/img] [/CENTER][/SPOILER]

item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

iz3 legend:

Project Insanity won’t die until a simpler base comes out. Everyone tries to inspire people to use a more complicated base, but the new programmers will always choose the easiest base.

I tried to tackle Hyperion… it wasn’t easy.

item.title: Project Hyperion [PH] - [Killing PI]
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:32, topic:438444”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=541163.msg3964441#msg3964441 date=1333574259]

Wait, what client are you using? Is it a 317 with 500+ shit packed?

[/quote]

According to his media it is

Why do you load shitty graphics?

You mean model shades? It was an anti leech, I just fixed important ones like chars and items, I’ll fix objects in a bit.

I meant why do you let a 317 load shitty revisions, go program a 600 or something if you like runescape-ruined-revisions

So you would rather have a bunch of PI’s loading 600+ than have a hyperion loading +600? I mean come on…

Indeed PI is already fucked up, no need to do that with hyperion[/quote]

Yea loading higher revision content onto a client will ruin a server completely!

No, just kidding you sound like an idiot.

Goodluck relex, that guy who fixed that 1 problem with my hitmarks still hasn’t signed in yet, but if you want to PM him on here, his username is deathschaos9. Tell him I sent you :D. Have fun with the project.

Read full topic

item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

He’s mainly loading the 600 gameframe or whatever it is, I don’t see a problem with his graphics… If his cache is under 30MB, I’m content… The PI caches (ZIPPED) are now over 150MB, I’ve seen 300MB caches before. It DISGUSTS me.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Hyperion [PH] - [Killing PI]
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“relexlawl, post:35, topic:438444”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=541163.msg3964450#msg3964450 date=1333574682]

Wait, what client are you using? Is it a 317 with 500+ shit packed?

According to his media it is

Why do you load shitty graphics?

You mean model shades? It was an anti leech, I just fixed important ones like chars and items, I’ll fix objects in a bit.

I meant why do you let a 317 load shitty revisions, go program a 600 or something if you like runescape-ruined-revisions

So you would rather have a bunch of PI’s loading 600+ than have a hyperion loading +600? I mean come on…

Indeed PI is already fucked up, no need to do that with hyperion

Oh ok, since there are so many people using hyperion, of course it would matter if I add what I feel like to my server project, and lets have hyperion just sitting in the download section unused by everyone…

Also I’m not forcing you to use this one I released? If you still want to use whatever server you use go ahead, this won’t affect you what-so-ever.

Why don’t you go program a higher revision instead of letting a 317 load what i shouldn’t load?
You might not force me but it bothers me
[/quote]

Just like it bothers you, it bothers me when people try to limit others into what they can and can’t use. If you really are bothered by this project, just don’t click the thread, simple.[/quote]
Can’t the force is to strong

Read full topic

item.title: Project Hyperion [PH] - [Killing PI]
item.dc:creator: @relexlawl relexlawl
item.description:
@relexlawl wrote:

RandQm:

Why do you load shitty graphics?

You mean model shades? It was an anti leech, I just fixed important ones like chars and items, I’ll fix objects in a bit.

@native, umm here’s the first class I made in hyperion (ever), might be a little messy, but as I said first class I made on hyperion:

package org.hyperion.rs2.content;

import org.hyperion.rs2.model.Player;
import org.hyperion.rs2.model.combat.CombatCurses;

/**
 * A class that handles usage of Quick Curses.
 * 
 * @author Relex lawl / Relex
 *
 */

public class QuickCurses {

	private enum QuickCurseData {
		PROTECT_ITEM(17202, CombatCurses.PROTECT_ITEM, 630),
		SAP_WARRIOR(17203, CombatCurses.SAP_WARRIOR, 631),
		SAP_RANGER(17204, CombatCurses.SAP_RANGER, 632),
		SAP_MAGE(17205, CombatCurses.SAP_MAGE, 633),
		SAP_SPIRIT(17206, CombatCurses.SAP_SPIRIT, 634),
		BERSERKER(17207, CombatCurses.BERSERKER, 635),
		DEFLECT_SUMMONING(17208, CombatCurses.DEFLECT_SUMMONING, 636),
		DEFLECT_MAGIC(17209, CombatCurses.DEFLECT_MAGIC, 637),
		DEFLECT_MISSILES(17210, CombatCurses.DEFLECT_MISSILES, 638),
		DEFLECT_MELEE(17211, CombatCurses.DEFLECT_MELEE, 639),
		LEECH_ATTACK(17212, CombatCurses.LEECH_ATTACK, 640),
		LEECH_RANGED(17213, CombatCurses.LEECH_RANGED, 641),
		LEECH_MAGIC(17214, CombatCurses.LEECH_MAGIC, 642),
		LEECH_DEFENCE(17215, CombatCurses.LEECH_DEFENCE, 643),
		LEECH_STRENGTH(17216, CombatCurses.LEECH_STRENGTH, 644),
		LEECH_ENERGY(17217, CombatCurses.LEECH_ENERGY, 645),
		LEECH_SPECIAL_ATTACK(17218, CombatCurses.LEECH_SPECIAL_ATTACK, 646),
		WRATH(17219, CombatCurses.WRATH, 647),
		SOUL_SPLIT(17220, CombatCurses.SOUL_SPLIT, 648),
		TURMOIL(17221, CombatCurses.TURMOIL, 649);
		
		/**
		 * Defining enum's parameters
		 */
		private int actionButtonID, curseID, configButtonID;
		/**
		 * Creation an instance for QuickCurseData enum.
		 * 
		 * @param actionButtonID	Curse's action button ID.
		 * @param curseID			Curse's unique ID.
		 * @param configID			Curse's check mark config ID.
		 */
		private QuickCurseData(final int actionButtonID, final int curseID, final int configButtonID) {
			this.actionButtonID = actionButtonID;
			this.curseID = curseID;
			this.configButtonID = configButtonID;
		}
		/**
		 * Getting QuickCurseData's action button ID.
		 * 
		 * @return	actionButtonID.
		 */
		private final int getActionButtonID() {
			return actionButtonID;
		}
		/**
		 * Getting QuickCurseData's prayer ID.
		 * 
		 * @return	curseID.
		 */
		private final int getCurseID() {
			return curseID;
		}
		/**
		 * Getting QuickCurseData's config button ID.
		 * 
		 * @return	configButtonID.
		 */
		private final int getConfigButtonID() {
			return configButtonID;
		}
	}
	/**
	 * Handles clicking on prayer's orb.
	 * 
	 * @param actionButtonID	actionButton being hit.
	 */
	public void selectCurse(final int actionButtonID) {
		final int curseID = getCurseIDForActionButton(actionButtonID);
		if (curseID == -1)
			return;
		toggleCheckmark(actionButtonID, !quickCurseSelected[curseID]);
		switch (curseID) {
			case CombatCurses.SAP_WARRIOR:
				toggleMultipleCheckmarks(CombatCurses.ATTACK_CURSES, curseID);
				toggleMultipleCheckmarks(CombatCurses.STRENGTH_CURSES, curseID);
				toggleMultipleCheckmarks(CombatCurses.DEFENCE_CURSES, curseID);
				break;
			case CombatCurses.SAP_RANGER:
				toggleMultipleCheckmarks(CombatCurses.RANGED_CURSES, curseID);
				toggleMultipleCheckmarks(CombatCurses.DEFENCE_CURSES, curseID);
				break;
			case CombatCurses.SAP_MAGE:
				toggleMultipleCheckmarks(CombatCurses.MAGIC_CURSES, curseID);
				toggleMultipleCheckmarks(CombatCurses.DEFENCE_CURSES, curseID);
				break;
			case CombatCurses.SAP_SPIRIT:
				toggleMultipleCheckmarks(CombatCurses.SPIRIT_CURSES, curseID);
				break;
			case CombatCurses.DEFLECT_SUMMONING:
			case CombatCurses.DEFLECT_MAGIC:
			case CombatCurses.DEFLECT_MISSILES:
			case CombatCurses.DEFLECT_MELEE:
			case CombatCurses.WRATH:
			case CombatCurses.SOUL_SPLIT:
				toggleMultipleCheckmarks(CombatCurses.OVERHEAD_CURSES, curseID);
				break;
			case CombatCurses.LEECH_ATTACK:
				toggleMultipleCheckmarks(CombatCurses.ATTACK_CURSES, curseID);
				break;
			case CombatCurses.LEECH_RANGED:
				toggleMultipleCheckmarks(CombatCurses.RANGED_CURSES, curseID);
				break;
			case CombatCurses.LEECH_MAGIC:
				toggleMultipleCheckmarks(CombatCurses.MAGIC_CURSES, curseID);
				break;
			case CombatCurses.LEECH_STRENGTH:
				toggleMultipleCheckmarks(CombatCurses.STRENGTH_CURSES, curseID);
				break;
			case CombatCurses.LEECH_ENERGY:
				toggleCheckmark(CombatCurses.TURMOIL, false);
				break;
			case CombatCurses.LEECH_SPECIAL_ATTACK:
				toggleMultipleCheckmarks(CombatCurses.SPIRIT_CURSES, curseID);
				toggleCheckmark(CombatCurses.TURMOIL, false);
				break;
			case CombatCurses.TURMOIL:
				toggleMultipleCheckmarks(CombatCurses.LEECH_CURSES, curseID);
				break;
		}
	}
	/**
	 * Opens quick prayer's interface when
	 * choosing select quick prayer option
	 * in prayer orb.
	 */
	public void openQuickCurseInterface() {
		loadCheckmarks();
		p.getActionSender().sendSidebarInterface(6, 18200);
		p.getActionSender().setViewedTab(6);
	}
	/**
	 * Confirms the quick prayer selection.
	 * Only then will quick curses with checkmarks
	 * take effect.
	 */
	public void confirmSelection() {
		for (int i = 0; i < quickCurseSelected.length; i++)
			quickCurses[i] = quickCurseSelected[i];
		p.getActionSender().sendSidebarInterface(6, 25500);
	}
	/**
	 * Handles clicking on prayer orb
	 * to turn quick curses on.
	 */
	public void toggleQuickCurses() {
		quickCursesOn = !quickCursesOn;
		final String value = quickCursesOn ? "on" : "off";
		p.getActionSender().sendString(-1, ":quicks: " + value);
		p.getCombatCurses().deactivateAllCurses();
		if (quickCursesOn) {
			for (int i = 0; i < quickCurses.length; i++) {
				if (quickCurses[i])
					p.getCombatCurses().activateCurse(i);
			}
		}
	}
	/**
	 * Loads checkmarks for chosen quick curses
	 * when select quick curses option is chosen.
	 */
	private void loadCheckmarks() {
		for (int i = 0; i < quickCurseSelected.length; i++) {
			final QuickCurseData qpd = getQuickCurseDataForCurseID(i);
			try {
				toggleCheckmark(qpd.getConfigButtonID(), quickCurses[i]);
			} catch (Exception e) {
				System.out.println("error loading checkmark #" + i);
			}
		}
	}
	/**
	 * Handles checkmark configs,
	 * both adding and taking away.
	 * 
	 * @param actionButtonID	Curse's actionButtonID.
	 * @param addCheckmark		Whether or not to add a checkmark.
	 */
	private void toggleCheckmark(final int actionButtonID, boolean addCheckmark) {
		for (QuickCurseData qpd : QuickCurseData.values()) {
			if (qpd.getActionButtonID() == actionButtonID) {
				p.getActionSender().sendConfig(qpd.getConfigButtonID(), addCheckmark ? 1 : 0);
				quickCurseSelected[qpd.getCurseID()] = addCheckmark;
			}
		}
	}
	/**
	 * Handles checkmark configs,
	 * same as toggleCheckmark, but for multiple prayers.
	 * 
	 * @param curseIDs		Curse IDs' checkmarks to take away.
	 * @param curseID		Curse ID that's not affected.
	 */
	private void toggleMultipleCheckmarks(final int[] curseIDs, final int curseID) {
		for (int i = 0; i < curseIDs.length; i++) {
			if (curseIDs[i] != curseID) {
				QuickCurseData qpd = getQuickCurseDataForCurseID(curseIDs[i]);
				toggleCheckmark(qpd.getActionButtonID(), false);
			}
		}
	}
	/**
	 * Gets QuickCurseData for curse ID.
	 * 
	 * @param curseID		Curse ID's QuickCurseData to return.
	 * @return				Curse ID's QuickCurseData.
	 */
	private QuickCurseData getQuickCurseDataForCurseID(final int curseID) {
		for (QuickCurseData qpd : QuickCurseData.values()) {
			if (qpd.getCurseID() == curseID)
				return qpd;
		}
		return null;
	}
	/**
	 * Gets prayer ID for an action button.
	 * 
	 * @param actionButtonID	ActionButtonID's prayer to return. 
	 * @return					ActionButtonID's curseID.
	 */
	private static final int getCurseIDForActionButton(final int actionButtonID) {
		for (QuickCurseData qpd : QuickCurseData.values()) {
			if (qpd.getActionButtonID() == actionButtonID) {
				//System.out.println("CurseID: " + qpd.getCurseID());
				return qpd.getCurseID();
			}
		}
		return -1;
	}
	/**
	 * Checks if <code> actionButtonID </code>
	 * is a valid quick prayer button.
	 * 
	 * @param actionButtonID	ActionButtonID to check.
	 * @return					ActionButtonID is a valid quick prayer button.
	 */
	public static final boolean isQuickCurseButton(final int actionButtonID) {
		boolean value = false;
		for (QuickCurseData qpd : QuickCurseData.values()) {
			if (qpd.getActionButtonID() == actionButtonID) {
				value = true;
				break;
			}
		}
		return value;
	}
	/**
	 * Adding a Player instance.
	 */
	private Player p;
	/**
	 * Creating QuickCurses per Player
	 * 
	 * @param p		Single player to create an instance for.
	 */
	public QuickCurses(Player p) {
		this.p = p;
	}
	/**
	 * Used to add a temporary checkmark for curses.
	 */
	public boolean[] quickCurseSelected = new boolean[20];
	/**
	 * Used for actual quick curses Player p has chosen.
	 */
	public boolean[] quickCurses = new boolean[20];
	/**
	 * Checks if Player p already has quick curses on.
	 */
	public boolean quickCursesOn = false;
}

item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“relexlawl, post:20, topic:438444”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=541163.msg3964412#msg3964412 date=1333573212]

@superman

Delta was “number 1” before too…

my point is that it won’t die…

Oh shit, you’re a psychic?

Delta is pretty much dead. It took a few years for it to happen, but it happened.

Hyperion would probably take over if it had the main key features of content… I would use Hyperion if it had a finished combat base, but it doesn’t and I couldn’t make my own combat base if I tried.
[/quote]

That’s why I made this project, the goal is to add all features/content PI has + more.[/quote]
It’s very impressive. Let me know if you ever need any help.
